awd_titl_txt: Few-Body Problems at the Atomic Level
awd_abstract_narration: In this project in the Theortetical and Computational                           PhysicalChemistry Program of the Chemistry Division, Prof.                      Berry will calculate the behavior of few-body systems at the                    atomic level. The work will examine vibration-rotation states                   of small molecules and freezing and melting in clusters of                      molecules.                                                                                                                                                      Electron correlation in atoms, especially the determination of                  the best approximate quantum numbers for particular states,                     will be quantified.  The dynamics of highly excited rotation-                   vibration states will be used to predict spectra involving                      large amplitude motion and nonrigid behavior. Analysis of how                   chaos and ergodicity develop as functions of energy will be                     examined during solid-liquid phase changes in small clusters.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
